alert.note: Alert for Ashtabula; Geauga (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 21 at 11:35PM EDT until August 22 at 1:30AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT MONDAY FOR CENTRAL ASHTABULA AND EAST CENTRAL GEAUGA COUNTIES... At 1135 PM EDT, Thunderstorms produced heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Ashtabula, Conneaut, North Kingsville, Middlefield, Burton, Huntsburg, Claridon, Austinburg, Montville, Kingsville, Hartsgrove, Roaming Shores, Rock Creek, Plymouth Center, Edgewood and Kelloggsville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
